The discussion on CNN: s "The Lead with Jake Tapper" between Anita Dunn and Genevieve Wood, where they debated the pay gap and the claim that young women in metropolitan areas who are childless and single are out-earning young males.
The statistic that women make 77 cents f: which was widely reported on Equal Pay Day and is seen by many Democrats as evidence of an unfair pay structure.
The argument made by Genevieve Wood: a conservative pundit with the Heritage Foundation, that the wage gap disappears when comparing women and men in the same job with similar backgrounds and experiences.
The reference to a 2012 U: S. News and World Report article, reposted on the website of the conservative American Enterprise Institute, which states that single, childless women in their 20s in metropolitan areas earn 8 percent more on average than their male counterparts.
